009package imagingbook.common.geometry.circle;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.abs;
013import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
014
015import java.awt.Color;
016import java.awt.Shape;
017import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
018import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
019import java.util.Locale;
020
021import ij.IJ;
022import ij.gui.Roi;
023import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Curve2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.ShapeProvider;
027import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
028
029
030public class GeometricCircle implements Circle, ShapeProvider, Curve2d {
031        
032        static int DefaultSteps = 200;
033        
034        private final double xc, yc, r;
035        
036        public static int getDefaultSteps() {
037                return DefaultSteps;
038        }
039
040        public double getXc() {
041                return xc;
042        }
043
044        public double getYc() {
045                return yc;
046        }
047
048        public double getR() {
049                return r;
050        }
051
052        public GeometricCircle(double xc, double yc, double r) {
053                if (r < 0) {
054                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("negative circle radius");
055                }
056                this.xc = xc;
057                this.yc = yc;
058                this.r = r;             
059        }
060        
061        public GeometricCircle(double[] p) {
062                this(p[0], p[1], p[2]);
063        }
064        
065        public static GeometricCircle from(AlgebraicCircle ac) {
066                double[] p = ac.getParameters();
067                if (Arithmetic.isZero(p[0])) {
068                        throw new RuntimeException("infinite circle radius");
069                }
070                double A = p[0];
071                double B = p[1];
072                double C = p[2];
073                double D = p[3];
074                double xc = -B / (2 * A);
075                double yc = -C / (2 * A);
076                double r =   sqrt(sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D) / abs(2 * A);
077                return new GeometricCircle(xc, yc, r);
078        }
079        
080        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        @Override
083        public double[] getParameters() {
084                return new double[] {xc, yc, r};
085        }
086        
087        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
088        
089        /**
090         * Calculate and returns the mean of the squared distances between this circle 
091         * and a set of 2D points.
092         *
093         * @param points a set of sample points (usually the points used for fitting)
094         * @return the mean squared error
095         */
096        public double getMeanSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
097                final int n = points.length;
098                double sumR2 = 0;
099                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
100//                      double[] rxy = getError(points[i]);
101//                      sumR2 += sqr(rxy[0]) + sqr(rxy[1]);
102                        sumR2 += sqr(getDistance(points[i]));
103                }
104                return sumR2 / n;
105        }
106        
107//      public double getError2(Pnt2d[] points) {
108//              final int n = points.length;
109//              double sumR2 = 0;
110//              for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
111//                      double x = points[i].getX();                                                    // sample point
112//                      double y = points[i].getY();            
113//                      double ri = Math.sqrt(sqr(x - xc) + sqr(y - yc));               // sample distance from center
114//                      sumR2 += sqr(r - ri);                                                                   // squared r-difference
115//              }
116//              
117//              return sumR2 / n;
118//      }
119        
120        /**
121         * Returns the (unsigned) distance between the specified point
122         * and this circle. The result is always non-negative.
123         * 
124         * @param p a 2D point
125         * @return the point's distance from the circle
126         */
127        @Override
128        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
129                return Math.abs(getSignedDistance(p));
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Returns the signed distance between the specified point
134         * and this circle. The result is positive for points outside
135         * the circle, negative inside.
136         * 
137         * @param p a 2D point
138         * @return the point's signed distance from the circle
139         */
140        public double getSignedDistance(Pnt2d p) {
141                double dx = p.getX() - this.xc;
142                double dy = p.getY() - this.yc;
143                double rp = Math.hypot(dx, dy);
144                return rp - this.r;
145        }
146        
147//      @Deprecated
148//      double[] getError(Pnt2d point) {

150//              double y = point.getY();

155//              double rri = ri / r;

161//      }

171//              return res;
172//      }
173        
174        public GeometricCircle disturb(double dxc, double dyc, double dr) {
175                return new GeometricCircle(xc + dxc, yc + dyc, r + dr);
176        }
177        
178        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
179        
180        @Deprecated
181        public static double MarkerRadius = 4;          // marker radius
182        @Deprecated
183        public static int CircleSubdivisions = 200;     // subdivisions for small circles
184        @Deprecated
185        public static double CircleMaxSegmentLength = 4.0;      // max. segment length for large circles
186        
187        @Deprecated
188        public Roi makeRoi(int width, int height, Color strokeColor, double strokeWidth) {                      
189                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
190                
191                addCenterPath(path, MarkerRadius);
192                if (this.r < 5 * (width + height)) {
193                        IJ.log("drawing small circle " + this.toString());
194                        addSmallCirclePath(path, CircleSubdivisions);
195                }
196                else {
197                        IJ.log("drawing large circle " + this.toString());
198                        addLargeCirclePath(path, CircleMaxSegmentLength, width, height);
199                }
200                
201                Roi roi = new ShapeRoi(path);
202                roi.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
203                roi.setStrokeWidth(strokeWidth);
204                return roi;
205        }
206        
207        @Deprecated
208        private void addCenterPath(Path2D path, double d) {
209                path.moveTo(xc - d, yc);
210                path.lineTo(xc + d, yc);
211                path.moveTo(xc, yc - d);
212                path.lineTo(xc, yc + d);
213        }
214        
215        
216        @Deprecated
217        private void addSmallCirclePath(Path2D path, int nSteps) {
218                for (int i = 0; i <= nSteps; i++) {
219                        double theta = 2 * Math.PI * i / nSteps;
220                        double xt = xc + r * Math.cos(theta);
221                        double yt = yc + r * Math.sin(theta);
222                        if (i == 0) {
223                                path.moveTo(xt, yt);
224                        }
225                        else {
226                                path.lineTo(xt, yt);
227                        }
228                }
229                //path.closePath();     
230        }
231        
232        /**
233         * Creates a circle path that is only inside the given W*H rectangle.
234         * Primitive, still needs a lot of tests for very large circles.
235         * @param dr max. segment length
236         * @param w width of rectangle
237         * @param h height of rectangle
238         */
239        @Deprecated
240        private void addLargeCirclePath(Path2D path, double dr, int w, int h) {
241                int nSteps = (int) Math.ceil(2 * this.r * Math.PI / dr);
242                boolean wasOutside = true;
243                double xprev = Double.NaN;      // previous circle point (may be outside)
244                double yprev = Double.NaN;
245                for (int i = 0; i <= nSteps; i++) {     
246                        double theta = 2 * Math.PI * i / nSteps;
247                        double x = xc + r * Math.cos(theta);
248                        double y = yc + r * Math.sin(theta);
249                        if (isInside(x, y, w, h)) {
250                                if (wasOutside) {                                       // start a new segment
251                                        if (Double.isFinite(xprev)) {   // x/y is not the first point
252                                                // we came from outside and there is a predecessor point
253                                                path.moveTo(xprev, yprev);
254                                                path.lineTo(x, y);
255                                        } else {                
256                                                path.moveTo(x, y);
257                                        }
258                                        wasOutside = false;                     // we are inside now!
259                                } else {                                                // continue segment
260                                        path.lineTo(x, y);
261                                }
262                        } else {
263                                wasOutside = true;              // we are outside again or still
264                        }
265                        xprev = x;
266                        yprev = y;
267                }
268        }
269        
270        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
271        
272        @Deprecated
273        public Path2D getOutlinePath() {
274                return getOutlinePath(DefaultSteps);
275        }
276        
277        
278        @Deprecated
279        public Path2D getCenterPath(double d) {
280                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
281                path.moveTo(xc - d, yc);
282                path.lineTo(xc + d, yc);
283                path.moveTo(xc, yc - d);
284                path.lineTo(xc, yc + d);
285                return path;
286        }
287        
288        @Deprecated
289        public Path2D getOutlinePath(int nSteps) {
290                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();      
291                for (int i = 0; i < nSteps; i++) {
292                        double theta = 2 * Math.PI * i / nSteps;
293                        double xt = xc + r * Math.cos(theta);
294                        double yt = yc + r * Math.sin(theta);
295                        if (i == 0) {
296                                path.moveTo(xt, yt);
297                        }
298                        else {
299                                path.lineTo(xt, yt);
300                        }
301                }
302                path.closePath();       
303                return path;
304        }
305        
306        /**
307         * Creates a circle path that is only inside the given W*H rectangle.
308         * Primitive, still needs a lot of tests for very large circles.
309         * @param dr max. segment length
310         * @param w width of rectangle
311         * @param h height of rectangle
312         * @return the outer circle path
313         */
314        @Deprecated
315        public Path2D getOutlinePath(double dr, int w, int h) {
316                int nSteps = (int) Math.ceil(2 * this.r * Math.PI / dr);
317                //IJ.log("nSteps = " + nSteps);
318                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
319//              int cnt = 0;
320                boolean wasOutside = true;
321                double xprev = Double.NaN;      // previous circle point (may be outside)
322                double yprev = Double.NaN;
323                for (int i = 0; i <= nSteps; i++) {     
324                        double theta = 2 * Math.PI * i / nSteps;
325                        double x = xc + r * Math.cos(theta);
326                        double y = yc + r * Math.sin(theta);
327                        if (isInside(x, y, w, h)) {
328                                if (wasOutside) {                                       // start a new segment
329                                        if (Double.isFinite(xprev)) {   // x/y is not the first point
330                                                // we came from outside and there is a predecessor point
331                                                path.moveTo(xprev, yprev);
332                                                path.lineTo(x, y);
333                                        } else {                
334                                                path.moveTo(x, y);
335                                        }
336                                        wasOutside = false;                     // we are inside now!
337                                } else {                                                // continue segment
338                                        path.lineTo(x, y);
339                                }
340//                              cnt++;
341                        } else {
342                                wasOutside = true;              // we are outside again or still
343                        }
344                        xprev = x;
345                        yprev = y;
346                }
347                //path.closePath();     
348                //IJ.log("cnt = " + cnt);
349                return path;            // return null if path is empty??
350        }
351        
352        // This is actually used ------------------------------------
353        
354        static double DefaultCenterMarkRadius = 3;
355        
356        public Shape getCenterShape() {
357                return getCenterShape(DefaultCenterMarkRadius);
358                
359        }
360        public Shape getCenterShape(double radius) {
361                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
362                path.moveTo(xc - radius, yc);
363                path.lineTo(xc + radius, yc);
364                path.moveTo(xc, yc - radius);
365                path.lineTo(xc, yc + radius);
366                return path;
367        }
368        
369        public Shape getOuterShape() {
370                return new Arc2D.Double(xc - r, yc - r, 2 * r, 2 * r, 0, 360, Arc2D.OPEN);
371        }
372        
373        @Override
374        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
375                return getOuterShape() ;
376        }
377        
378        @Override
379        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
380                return new Shape[] {getOuterShape(), getCenterShape(scale)};
381        }
382        
383        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
384        
385        @Deprecated
386        private boolean isInside(double x, double y, double w, double h) {
387                if (x < 0 || x > w) return false;
388                if (y < 0 || y > h) return false;
389                return true;
390        }
391        
392        @Override
393        public String toString() {
394                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [xc=%f, yc=%f, r=%f]", 
395                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), xc, yc, r);
396        }
397
398
399        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
400
401        public static void main(String[] args) {
402                GeometricCircle c = new GeometricCircle(0, 0, 7);
403                Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(0, -8);
404                System.out.println("d2 = " + c.getDistance(p));
405                
406                AlgebraicCircle ca = new AlgebraicCircle(1.3, -2, 5, 1);
407                GeometricCircle cg = GeometricCircle.from(ca);
408                System.out.println("cg = " + cg);
409                // cg = GeometricCircle [xc=0.769231, yc=-1.923077, r=1.876356]
410        }
